snippet: Will Tom Wheeler’s long career representing the interests of telecommunications companies make it hard for him to be an independent and fair regulator?
abstract: Editorial criticizes Pres Obama's nomination of former telecommunications lobbyist and campaign fund-raiser Tom Wheeler for chairman of Federal Communications Commission; questions whether Wheeler's long career representing interests of telecommunications companies will make it hard for him to be independent and fair regulator.
lead_paragraph: Will Tom Wheeler’s long career representing the interests of telecommunications companies make it hard for him to be an independent and fair regulator?

headline.seo: Tom Wheeler, an Industry Man for the F.C.C.
headline.main: An Industry Man for the F.C.C.
headline.print_headline: An Industry Man for the F.C.C.
